fields.description: Check out the screenshot.
Something people can put on their blogs etc., first step towards spreading awareness.
Update libbucket.
fields.summary: Hook when pushing displays size per repo, not size in total

fields.description:
h1. Create a new issue
h1. In several comments, add attachments to it.
h1. Note how the attachments list doesn't look too great
IMHO, the attachments list should probably go vertical rather than horizontal and possibly should be separate from the initial issue comment.

h1. Create new issue
h1. In a new comment, add an attachment to the issue
h1. Note that the fact you added an attachment (much less which attachment) isn't shown in your comment like if you e.g. changed the milestone. It probably should be.
fields.summary: adding attachment not noted in issue

fields.description: Add the ability to tag issues (ala blog posts). This could be overkill.
Perhaps the Report Bug / Request Feature link in the bitbucket footer should point to http://www.bitbucket.org/jespern/bitbucket/issues/new/ rather than the Google Group?
fields.summary: change report bug & request feature links

fields.description:
The current footer says:

This is an issue notification from bitbucket.org.\\
You are receiving this either because you are the\\
owner of the issue, or have asked to be notified.

As far as I can tell, the only way to "ask to be notified" is to be a follow-er of the issue. The footer should be rephrased to reflect this, e.g.:

This is an issue notification from bitbucket.org.\\
You are receiving this either because you are the\\
owner of the issue, or you are following [or are a follower of, or however you phrase it] the issue.
this would be equivalent to the severity and priority fields in Bugzilla, except combined into 1 field for simplicity.

The Admin page for a repo has a "Permissions" section. The explanations of what readers and writers are should be moved to the top of their respective boxes, closer to the titles. For that matter, could we remove the all-caps on the titles (i.e. READERS) ?
fields.summary: improve layout of permissions section on Admin page

fields.description: show # followers and # forks on BB repo list, i.e. http://www.bitbucket.org/repo/all/
See http://github.com/popular/forked and http://github.com/popular/watched
fields.summary: list most watched and most forked projects somewhere (BB-408)

fields.description: Have a public project be picked randomly daily and feature it somewhere on the homepage and/or newsfeed pages. See GitHub's homepage (http://github.com/) for an example.

Some basic form of issue dependency tracking would be nice.

Basically, be able to say that issue A depends on issues X, Y, and Z, and have A refer to X, Y, and Z on its page and give their statuses and/or titles. And vice-versa.
fields.summary: allow bugs to depend on each other

fields.description: Like GitHub does to keep the supposedly private sourcecode secure and completely private.
fields.summary: All links should use https for logged-in users (BB-506)

fields.description:
Currently only paginator on top.

Consider using e.g. jquery.hotkeys to add keyboard shortcuts for next/previous page. This would go for all paginators.
fields.summary: Newsfeed needs paginator at the bottom too

fields.description:
The "Properties" section in the "create new issue" page is floating in the corner of the box and intruding on the text field, which is kinda awkward. See attached screenshot (Firefox 3 on Mac OS X)

The section should either be moved below the text field or the text field should be moved down to make space for it.
As subject says - "To:" field contains full list of recipients, should be "Bcc:" instead
fields.summary: Issue notification e-mail reveals addresses of other followers

fields.description:
http://www.bitbucket.org/bbangert/dozer/diff/?diff2=8b8e6861e08f&diff1=723ca5e19d25

Look into this.
When you fork a private repository, you should end up with a private repo pr. default. The same goes for issues and wiki. Everything should inherit the privacy settings.
fields.summary: Forking private repo should yield private repo

fields.description: No reason to send yourself a notification.
fields.summary: Fork notification on own repo should stay quiet

fields.description: Like, your own repositories should be on top, then a separator, and then the repositories from other users that you have access to in the username / repo format used elsewhere.
fields.summary: Repository dropdown on top should segment things

fields.description: Make it happen.
fields.summary: Should be case insensitive on usernames

fields.description:
The templates must not access RelatedManager's and needs to have any objects they want handed to them by the views.

See BCLOUD-149 for the retionale for this ticket.
Stole the idea from a blog: http://lucumr.pocoo.org/cogitations/2008/09/14/bitbucket-is-no-bit-bucket/
Lysander, art thou avail? Scheduled imports from externals should be easy.
Think Django has something like it. An error message at the very least.
fields.summary: Fallback session when cookies not possible

fields.description: On the advanced query editing list, the milestones list should be sorted.
fields.summary: Milestone list on query list not sorted

fields.description: Make sure column content for milestone/component/etc doesn't wrap, and truncate instead.

I would love to mirror a few repos here to make it easier for contributors to contribute and don't like the idea of either creating a separate account for mirroring from the server or adding the server ssh key to my username for various reasons.

It would be great if an administrator could add extra ssh keys to the repository that can write via ssh to simplify mirroring.

One of [[http://trac.edgewall.org|Trac]]s killer features is the ability to embed a ticket query in a wiki page so that the issues appear inline in a table. (See the TicketQuery [[http://trac.edgewall.org/wiki/WikiMacros|wiki macro]])

This lets you use a wiki page to focus on the next milestone by putting a list of tasks in amongst the goals text and links to less immediate information.
fields.summary: Embedding a ticket query in a wiki page

fields.description: Often there is a lot of detail around what a milestone means (goals, deadlines, etc). It would be nice if the milestone labels were links to a wiki page so that when you encounter a milestone in a bug report etc. you can jump straight to a page describing the milestone.
fields.summary: Milestones should be linked to a Wiki page

fields.description:
A time estimate field in the issues would allow Agile processes.

Simply being able to record a time estimate would be enough, but getting total time estimates by milestone would be great, and being able to see a burndown chart (preferably embeddable in a wiki page) would be spectacular.

There is often a temptation to add "total time" and "percent complete" etc, but a single field "time remaining" is enough.
fields.summary: Add a time estimate field to issues

fields.description:
It would be helpful if the title field is wider when creating a new issue.

The content field could be bigger too, but the title field is more critical.

Got a few in mind:

<<milestone foo>>, will make a list of issues on that milestone and some basic statistics

<<issue foo>>, will spit out a link to the issue, with a description, last updated, number of followers

Suggestions welcome!
http://code.google.com/p/django-logging/wiki/Overview
http://south.aeracode.org/
Also, make it larger.
fields.summary: Remove "Enter your message here" from the box when editing wiki pages

fields.description: It'd be nice if there was a page of the issuetracker that gave some basic stats, e.g. # of open issues, # of total issues in the tracker, # of issues with each status, etc

Currently it doesn't appear like the user dropdown for repositories is sorted in any particular order.

Sorting it alphabetically would be nice.
lists.bitbucket.org - mailman? It's in python.

Hi there,\\
it would be nice to have syntax highlighting for pyrex files. Currently this not supported and there are treated as simple text files. Example here: http://www.bitbucket.org/dfdeshom/v8onpython/src/73f48c520149/v8onpython.pyx
Separate from the Mine query, there should be an "Interested" or similar query that gives a list of all the issues you're following.

# create a new issue, don't assign it to anyone
# observe that the Responsible field says "nobody"
# assign the issue to an actual user
# observe that the issue tracker says "Changed responsible from nothing to some_user" instead of "Changed responsible from nobody to some_user"

hg repo: http://www.bitbucket.org/ctrochalakis/tx-submissions/overview/\\
rev: 3a3888e7ab1d

The diff calculated in changeset view is wrong (file transifex/controllers.py), http://www.bitbucket.org/ctrochalakis/tx-submissions/changeset/3a3888e7ab1d/

The correct one is here:\\
http://www.bitbucket.org/ctrochalakis/tx-submissions/diff/transifex/controllers.py?diff2=3a3888e7ab1d&diff1=2dc94b06be52

I don't know if it's relevant but the last time this file was modified was in a _merge_ commit. (2dc94b06be52)
"new issue" notification emails currently only include the reporter's username. They should also include their real name, like the comment notification emails.
fields.summary: new issue notifications lack reporter's name

fields.description:
# change the state of an issue (e.g. put it on hold) but leave the "content" field empty
# observe that the notification email for the change doesn't include the info on who made it (i.e. First Last / username). In contrast, if you include a comment with the change, your info is included.\\
Solution: include the changer's info in the email whether they make a comment or not

When one chooses "duplicate" from the "set state to" pulldown, a box should appear to input the number of the issue this is a dupe of so you don't have to write the boilerplate specifying the original issue yourself. And a link to the original issue should be displayed in an integrated way in the tracker.
fields.summary: more official way of specifying dupes

fields.description: Makes it a lot easier to read/paste around.
fields.summary: Add a slug description of the issue to the end of the URL

fields.description: Makes it a lot easier to read/paste around.
fields.summary: Add a slug description of the issue to the end of the URL

fields.description: cause "bump" messages suck

An option for CIA (http://cia.vc/doc/) reporting would be cool. There's a mercurial client available from http://hg.kublai.com/mercurial/hgcia\\
Or whenever the bitbucket API gets created, someone could always build the feature from that instead.

Hi there,\\
I have a README file at http://www.bitbucket.org/dfdeshom/pyreallib/src/  that displays weird characters like ">>>" . Any chance this could be corrected?
fields.summary: display of README file contains weird characters

fields.description:
When viewing the file structure in a specified revision (/src/<rev-hash>/ page), file links are using this url format:

"/src/<last-rev-hash>/<filename>"

Where <last-rev-hash> is the _last revision_ the file was edited. I think this behavior is a bit confusing. Someone would expect this to be "/src/<rev-hash>/<filename>" where <rev-hash> is the revision we are viewing.

This url practice is used by all known dvcs web frontends (hgweb, gitweb, github)

From Christos Τrochalakis (ctrochalakis):

It would make sense if we could\\
use urls that always point to the *tip* version of the source files.

something like: http://www.bitbucket.org/ctrochalakis/tx-submissions/tip/README
fields.summary: Link to tip version of source files

fields.description:
Example:

http://www.bitbucket.org/ches/pylons/changeset/4512631112e1

It'd be great if I could click on each file and see changes, if they in turn are not too large. At the very least, we shouldn't see links to anchors that don't really exist.
fields.summary: Should be able to display hunks from individual files if entire changeset is too large

fields.description: Wonder why we hadn't thought of that. Thanks, durin42!
Sounds like a good idea, or?
fields.summary: Allow project admins to specify CSS to use for code highlight

fields.description: There's some signal mess, etc. Shouldn't be too difficult.
fields.summary: Get up to speed on Django 1.0 RC

fields.description:
Pointed out by Steven Compall, we should allow "folding" a diff upwards by using interdiff:

http://hgbook.red-bean.com/hgbookch13.html#x17-31500013.9.2
fields.summary: MQ diffs are less than useful (BB-2500)

fields.description:
Example: http://www.bitbucket.org/hoffstein/ubiquity/src/32a3558f6981/stock-quote-screenshot.jpg

"View image" link points to nowhere, "raw" link (from history/annotate/raw group) works as expected
fields.summary: "View image" link in source browser is not active

fields.description:
The public newsfeed is periodically "spammed" by the frequent django-commits, so it's hard to follow progress of other repos you're following without having to go through a lot of pages.

How about we group events together when there are more than two consecutive events from one repo? And then add a "show more from django"-link, that takes you to e.g. http://bitbucket.org/news/?repo=django which filters out events for that django only?

See http://www.bitbucket.org/coffeemug/weblocks-dev/descendants/

http://www.bitbucket.org/jwr/weblocks-jwr/overview/ is a public fork of that repo, so it should show.

# Go to an issue tracker
# Click the "Mine" button
# Click the State column to sort by stats
# Notice that all issues are shown, not just those of the query
Makes the repo seem larger, which it is not.
Otherwise it doesn't really say what happened properly.
fields.summary: Upon fork, do not create "created" event, rather "forked"

fields.description:
http://www.bitbucket.org/parren/hg-stacks/overview/

Is a fork, but no indication of such.
Screen grab in attachment
http://softwaremaniacs.org/soft/highlight/en/
fields.summary: Highlight via JS instead of pygments for most stuff

fields.description: From the admin interface.
Or, we can add another radio saying "Resolve", or something.
fields.summary: "Set status to" should default to "resolved", not "open"

fields.description: Getting a lot of errors from Googlebot on this one.

I think: http://www.bitbucket.org/jespern/bitbucket/issue/180/

Haven't seen this before, could've been introduced recently? Odd.

http://www.bitbucket.org/jespern/bitbucket/issues/query/

I don't have access to repository but top navigation elements shows otherwise, displaying number of followers, clone url, etc

Nothing serious, probably one "if" tag at template level...
fields.summary: Top navigation element doesn't say repository is private when editing query

fields.description:
I just posted BCLOUD-180 being not logged in (didn't noticed that) and "follow issue updates" was available and selected by default.

I guess anonymous users should be able to leave email address or have this option completely hidden.
fields.summary: Anonymous users shouldn't see "follow issue updates" when creating new ticket

fields.description:
It would be really cool to have some options for integrating bitbucket into already established workflows (Basecamp, activeCollab, etc).

github solved this in very smart way, maybe it would be possible to do same thing with bitbucket? (yes! please!)

http://github.com/blog/53-github-services-ipo
fields.summary: Post commit actions aka services integration

fields.description: No need to print _everything_ :)

To reproduce:

# Go to an issue in a repo you don't have write access to
# Edit the title of the issue
# Observe that the title remains unchanged, yet no error message is shown.
fields.summary: Title change permissions set too high

fields.description:
For me at least, on the bitbucket issues, the "Mine" button gives back no results.\\
When I go to edit the query, it's showing the conditions are "Reported by: cvrebert" (which is correct) AND "Responsible is: prencher" (NOT right!)\\
Removing the second condition from the query, I get the correct results.
Would be nice with an option in issues-admin where you can choose a person that will be selected as "assigned to" on the create new issue page.
On a new repo, the quick guide contains 'overview' in the clone url.
Would help a lot of confusion people seem to have.
Discussed this internally.
fields.summary: Multiple SSH keys should have better interface

fields.description: Remove everything that says newforms.
It should be possible to have more than one ssh key per account. The same key must not however exist in the system on more than one account.

It could be made possible to import issues and /possibly/ wiki pages from trac.

This would generally improve the issue trackers usability for open source projects using trac.
It should be possible to preview an issue before creating it.

The font face used inside the comment box on an issue should not be in fixed width if it is not displayed in fixed width (which it is not).

Issue text and comments should share the same font face in input and display fields.

Refs: BCLOUD-167.
fields.summary: Font face in issue comment box

fields.description: The content text box on the report page should be of the same kind as the comment text box. That is rich text and with the same font face.
fields.summary: Content box on report issue page

fields.description:
The action button should always be placed on the far right.

As an example, on the report issue page, the cancel button is on the right side, which is confusing.

This is a general issue that should cover all pages that contain buttons.

There should generally be a line spacing on pages with long text entries, such as the TOS page. The general rule of thumb with line spacing is font size + 3. So probably the line spacing should be set at 15px.

Suggestion by Terrence Brannon:

It would be neat when creating a repo if certain common things to be ignored could ignored automatically.

For example, emacs backup files.

Plain URLs in issue comments have their HTML links improperly escaped.\\
E.g. this link here:

http://www.bitbucket.org/jespern/bitbucket/issue/162/

I've created a quite small mirror repository of the pybench utility on  http://www.bitbucket.org/leosoto/pybench-mirror/ and then forked it as http://www.bitbucket.org/leosoto/jybench/ .

A few hours have passed and it is still not ready, so I think that the feature is not working at all (Note that the "pybench-mirror" repository took only a few seconds to push.
Should be fairly easy to put in.
fields.summary: When creating repo, should be able to select wiki/issues

fields.description: Should be fixed.

In the "Create new issue" page, we're now using insert_field, which has lead to warnings for required fields not showing.

Try to report a new issue, and don't select a value for "Type". The issue isn't created, but no warning is displayed.
fields.summary: [issues-new] required field warning not shown when using insert_field

fields.description:
Currently, we're showing "back to query | edit query" only after you've clicked on an issue in query results.

The edit query link should be visible also on the results page.
fields.summary: [issues-new] after performing an advanced query, an edit-link should be shown

fields.description: Must be wiki-styled :)
fields.summary: [issues-new] need template filter for issue comments
